sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Hello and welcome to Good Morning Europe. It's Thursday the 31st of March.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I'm Andrea Bolleifo and these are your top stories this hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russia launches new attacks in northern Ukraine despite a promise to scale back its offensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Germany activates its emergency fuel plan and braces for rationing as the row over how to pay for Russian gas continues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And as Hungary gets ready to vote, we look at what's at stake in Sunday's general election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russian forces continue to bombard areas near Kyiv and Chernihiv despite pledges to de-escalate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The moment of hope following Tuesday's peace talks in Turkey has all but disappeared.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Some 20 percent of troops have been pulled back, but Ukraine's President Volladimir zelensky in his nightly address warned moscow's focus is now the donbass region in the east you also see that at the same time russia is amassing forces for new attacks in the donbass and we are getting ready for this we don't believe anyone and in any insincere words there is a real situation on the battlefield and now it's the most important.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We won't give up anything and we'll fight for every meter of our land, for every citizen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russia's Defense Ministry has already confirmed it is redeploying troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The aim of the Russian Air Force's redeployment is to ramp up activity on the priority destinations and most importantly completing the operation to fully liberate the Donbas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But Moscow's battle plans keep changing from wanting to take the capital to redeploying eastwards.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's perplexing Washington, which claims President Putin is being misinformed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We obviously have information which we have now public, that he felt misled by the Russian military.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We believe he's being misinformed by his advisers about how badly the Russian military is performing and how the Russian economy is being crippled by sanctions because, again, his senior advisers are too afraid to tell him the truth.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile separatists are blaming a missile that reportedly killed two people and destroyed part of an apartment block in the rebel-controlled city of Donetsk in the Donbas region on Ukrainian forces. Samuel Romani is an associate fellow at the Royal United Services Institute. He says Russian forces in northern Ukraine

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: are planning to regroup, not withdraw.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's obvious that the battle lines to take over the capital and to enact a swift regime change that overthrew Zelensky was impossible. So the Russians are focusing where they believe they can win, and they're focusing on what they call the liberation of Donbas. And then once they've consolidated control over Curzon, Mariupol, and possibly major cities like Kharkiv and Odessa, they will continue to target other regions of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The American President Joe Biden spent almost an hour on a phone call with his Ukrainian

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: counterpart, Vladimir Zelensky, who renewed his push for powerful defensive weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: �We talked about specific defensive support,� wrote Zelensky on Twitter, and of a new package of strengthened sanctions and financial and humanitarian assistance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Strengthening sanctions was a proposal supported by the British Prime Minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: For Boris Johnson, their intensification must continue until the withdrawal of all Russian soldiers from Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: What we will also do, and I hope we have the support of the opposition in this, is make sure that there is no backsliding on sanctions by any of our friends and partners around the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In fact, we need now to ratchet up the economic pressure on Vladimir Putin and it is certainly inconceivable that any sanctions could be taken off simply because there is a ceasefire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European Union also reiterated that it will maintain pressure on Russia to stop its invasion and withdraw its troops from Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On Twitter, the head of European diplomacy reaffirmed the support of the EU to Ukraine and its people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Germany could be facing a severe shortage in their gas supplies after the G7 rejected Russia's demand that payments for Russian gas be made in rubles, citing a unilateral and clear breach of the existing agreements Kremlin spokesman Dimitri peskov said that should European countries refuse to pay in Russian currency Moscow would have to take decisions as it stands Europe receives 40 percent of its gas and 25 percent of its oil from Russia in light of the war in Ukraine EU leaders are racing to reduce their dependency on Russian energy imports. As Germany is highly dependent on Russian gas, Economics Minister Robert Habeck has initiated the early warning stage of their gas emergency plan to prepare for an eventual shortage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We are at a stage at the moment where we are looking closely at which flows may be at risk or may break off.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: That is not the case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Security of supply is guaranteed. All contracts are being served at the moment. If they were not being served, it would first be up to the market in the second stage to make the necessary changes or send signals to consumers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It is unclear how long the reserves would last in the event of a Russian supply stop.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Habeck says it will depend on the stock remaining in the storage facilities in the coming autumn and winter, and urged people to reduce their consumption as every kilowatt hour counts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: That's why I would like to combine the proclamation of the early warning stage with the appeal to companies as well as private consumers that they help us, that they help Germany, that they help Ukraine if they save gas or energy altogether.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The gas emergency plan has three stages. After the early warning stage comes the alert and emergency periods. Only in the third phase does the state intervene should this happen private households and institutions such as hospitals would then have priority in gas supplies russia's central bank and energy giant gasprom will present today the gas for rubles payment

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: mechanism designed for the so-called unfriendly countries, those who imposed sanctions on Russia over its invasion in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It was Vladimir Putin who imposed the deadline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, Putin's spokesman has said that Russia will not demand rubles for gas immediately this Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He says that the process of deliveries and payments is time-consuming.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We know that the G7 countries have refused Russia's demands and Austria and Germany have already triggered an early emergency plan for gas supplies. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz as well as Italy's Mario Draghi discussed the gas issue yesterday over the phone with Vladimir Putin but Russia's message for now is clear and it was voiced by the Speaker of Russia's lower house of parliament Vyacheslav valodin who wrote in telegram if you want gas find rubles the question is what would be russia's next move moscow gets 360 million euros per day from gas sales to the european union and it says it is ready to redirect it to other markets but many analysts are persuaded that this will not be possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Galina Polonskaya, Euronews from Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The World Health Organization says the number of people globally who have died with COVID-19

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: in the last week has jumped by more than 40%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: However, the number of new infections is falling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Around 10 million people tested positive for coronavirus in the last seven days, and more than 45,000 deaths were reported.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Many countries are now lifting most of their pandemic restrictions, choosing instead to rely on vaccinations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Dr Bharat Pankania is a senior clinical lecturer at the University of Exeter's medical school in the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He says additional vaccinations are effective, but don't address the underlying problem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There's clear evidence that it boosts the level of antibodies, and that level of antibodies boosted protects the especially vulnerable people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This is the older age group and people who've got other underlying conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So boosters is one way forward, but the other way, and equally important, is to immunise the rest of the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We cannot carry on boosting forever.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: What we need to do is suppress infections elsewhere. And when we suppress infections there, we will also forego the need for constant boosters here in the north, northwest European countries.
